subject: Marketing
title: Features vs Benefits
description: A fast breakdown of Features vs Benefits for builders.

hook.text: Apple never said the iPod had 5GB of storage. They said '1,000 songs in your pocket.'

buildup.text: Features describe what a product has. Benefits describe what a product does for you.

discovery.text: People don't buy products. They buy outcomesâ€”better health, more time, higher status.

twist.text: Engineers write features. Copywriters translate them into benefits that trigger desire.

climax.text: Every feature should answer one question: 'So what? Why does this matter to me?'

punchline.text: Nobody wants a drill. They want a hole in the wall.

quiz.question: How did Apple describe the iPod's 5GB storage?
options: The largest music storage device available
